comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: Fokker D.VII, Albatros D.Va, and Fokker Dr.I triplane aircraft of Jasta 27 during the early summer of 1918. Hermann Göring led this unit until being given command of Jagdgeschwader I following Richthofen's successor, Obltn. Wilhelm Reinhard's death in a flying accident flying the Zeppelin-Lindau D.I fighter during a flying competition to test new aircraft. Göring had flown the aircraft prior to Reinhard and had landed safely. Reinhard wasn't so lucky.
